pullRequest.title: Upgrade Hive to 2.3.6 for Iceberg
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR address the issue of #832 , upgrading Hive version from 1.2.1 to 2.3.6. The main reason to this upgrade is to make future work (Hive Iceberg support) easy to land to Iceberg codebase.
The way to achieve this is to make iceberg-hive code both compatible with Hive 1.2.1 and 2.3.6, also makes Hive dependencies provided to not contaminate the classpath.
I've already verified against Hive 2.3.6 and Spark 2.4.4 in a mini cluster environment.

nodes.bodyText: Use reflection to handle the API difference between Hive 1.2.1 and 2.3.6.
Since the version of Hive is unlikely to change, can we make this a static field?
Try to avoid catching Exception so that this doesn't swallow unexpected errors.
Do we need this HBase dependency? What is tephra used for?

nodes.bodyText: These versions don't match the versions that were specified by force in build.gradle.
